# Mobile App Development: Choosing Your Path

> "There are 6.8 billion smartphone users worldwide in 2024, representing 85% of the global population."

## The Mobile-First World

### Market Statistics

- **70%** of all digital media time is spent on mobile
- **54%** of global web traffic comes from mobile devices
- **$693 billion** global mobile app revenue in 2024
- **255 billion** app downloads in 2023

### Development Approaches

**Native Development**
- iOS: Swift, SwiftUI, UIKit
- Android: Kotlin, Jetpack Compose

**Cross-Platform**
- React Native (JavaScript/TypeScript)
- Flutter (Dart)
- Xamarin (.NET)

**Hybrid/Web**
- Ionic (Web technologies)
- Capacitor (Web + Native)
- Progressive Web Apps (PWA)

### When to Choose Native

‚úÖ **Performance-critical apps** (games, AR/VR, video editing)
‚úÖ **Platform-specific features** required
‚úÖ **Large budget and timeline**
‚úÖ **Separate iOS and Android teams**
‚úÖ **Complex animations and transitions**

### When to Choose Cross-Platform

‚úÖ **MVP or startup** with limited resources
‚úÖ **Content-driven apps** (news, social media)
‚úÖ **Business/enterprise apps**
‚úÖ **Small to medium team**
‚úÖ **Web development background**

### When to Choose Hybrid/PWA

‚úÖ **Simple content apps**
‚úÖ **Budget constraints**
‚úÖ **Web-first strategy**
‚úÖ **Quick prototypes**
‚úÖ **Existing web app** to mobilize
